5287.quoteText:
Pixel tags are very small images or small pieces of data embedded in images, also known as “web beacons” or “clear GIFs,” that can recognize cookies, the time and date a page is viewed, a description of the page where the pixel tag is placed, and similar information from your device. Local storage is similar to a cookie except that it can store larger amounts of information and can be stored elsewhere on your device.

We use cookies and similar technologies (collectively, “cookies”) for the following functions and purposes
5287.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

5292.quoteText: Some web browsers may transmit “do-not-track” signals to the websites with which the user communicates. Nexon currently does not take action in response to these signals.
